actions.committee: Senate Committee on Rules and Administration
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.

official_title: A resolution to amend the Standing Rules of the Senate to provide that committee reports of bills and resolutions shall contain an economic evaluation of the bill or resolution stating the extent (if any) to which the carrying out thereof will affect inflation or deflation in the national economy.

summary.text: Amends the Standing Rules of the Senate to require each report of a bill or resolution (except those by the Committee on Appropriations) to contain an economic evaluation which specifies the extent to which inflation or deflation of the national economy is affected therein. Directs that in lieu of such evaluation, a statement shall be provided explaining the reasons for any noncompliance.

titles.title: A resolution to amend the Standing Rules of the Senate to provide that committee reports of bills and resolutions shall contain an economic evaluation of the bill or resolution stating the extent (if any) to which the carrying out thereof will affect inflation or deflation in the national economy.
